CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 19, 1946, pg. 1, reads: "1439 'Hits' Monday - Hill Cashes In - After eighteen [illegible] of hoofing it over the rough and rocky streets of Pittsburgh, Bedford Avenue dwellers clamber eagerly aboard car 1439, the [il.] trolley to hit the streets of the city since Duquesne Light Company employes [employees] threw picket lines around local carbarns. Bedford Line did rushing business as residents of various sections utilized it in effort to avoid jitney-itis and its alternative, sore tootsies... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Men and women boarding the 85 Bedford trolley with billboard in background advertising Heinz green pea soup, Hill District
